name: Introduction to Engineering
description: Introduces students to the fundamentals of engineering, including mathematics, physics, and engineering principles.

name: Calculus I
description: Introduces the fundamentals of calculus, including derivatives, integrals, and limits.

name: Calculus II
description: Continues the study of calculus, including sequences and series, vectors, functions of several variables, and Fourier series.

name: Physics I
description: Introduces the fundamentals of physics, including mechanics, thermodynamics, and electricity.

name: Physics II
description: Continues the study of physics, including waves, optics, and modern physics.

name: Chemistry I
description: Introduces the fundamentals of chemistry, including atomic structure, chemical reactions, and thermodynamics.

name: Chemistry II
description: Continues the study of chemistry, including chemical equilibrium, electrochemistry, and organic chemistry.

name: Introduction to Nuclear Engineering
description: Introduces students to the basics of nuclear engineering, including nuclear reactions, radiation, and nuclear systems.

name: Nuclear Engineering I
description: Continues the study of nuclear engineering, including radiation detection, reactor design, and nuclear materials.

name: Nuclear Engineering II
description: Continues the study of nuclear engineering, including nuclear fuel cycle, nuclear waste management, and nuclear safety.
